Plano is easily accessible from highway 75, which connects to interstate 20 and runs straight through it. The nearest airport is
, which is approximately 30 minutes outside of Plano. The public rail system, DART, does not yet connect the airport to Plano. However, taxis and cars for hire are readily available.

Driving a car is by far the best way (and likely the only reasonable way) to travel in Plano. However, there is a public transit system, the DART, that connects Plano to Dallas via the red line which ends at Parker Station located at Parker and 75. From there you can take a Bus to lots of areas in Plano.  A day ticket costs US $4.00, $2.00 (Reduced for students with High School ID, Seniors 65+ and Children ages 5-14). Plano is a very large city, and a bike will not allow you to get where you want to be in a reasonable amount of time.

value: content=Museum started by a pest control specialist, featuring dead as well as very much alive and hissing cockroaches.

content=The Angelika plays an impressive and diverse mix of independent films, and is the definitive cinema of choice for filmmakers and film lovers alike.  Inside, the Café offers a light gourmet fare along with coffees, Champagne, beer and wine.
directions=On Parker 0.5 miles west of Midway Rd.  Going west it will be on your right.
content=A 200-acre park with a 2.3-mile paved path, a 2-mile unpaved path for off-road cycling, and many unpaved paths for pedestrians.
a basketball court in the neighborhood of Stoney Hollow. With a 2 dollar Admission fee.
directions=NW corner of Park and Dallas North Tollway in Plano.  DART Bus 347
content=A large two-story indoor mall.  The mall caters to upper middle class.  Most of the shops there are boutiques and expensive clothing stores.
directions=On Central Expressway between Plano Pkwy and 15th st.  DART FLEX route 870 from Downtown Plano station
content=A large two-story mall.  This is an older mall, and there are stores for just about everyone in most price ranges.
directions=NW Corner of Spring Creek Pkwy and K Ave. DART bus 350

content=A small to medium sized outlet mall.  It's not as big and exciting as Grapevine Mills, but you can find some interesting things here if you don't mind poking around.  The largest business here is Garden Ridge.
directions=Southbound side of Central Expressway between Park Blvd. and 15th St. DART Bus #350 (closest bus stop is Park & Chisolm Pl)

content=While this is mainly a place to find costume supplies, it's also a very unique shop to find various used clothes, shoes, jewelry, clothing accessories, props, and anything related to dressing up.  They're stocked floor-to-ceiling in this place, and the ailes are ver very narrow.  This shop is unique in the fact that it's overflowing with personality and is possibly the most claustrophobic store in all of DFW.
content=Serving unique and wonderful types of pizza.  They'll make more traditional pizza styles as well if you're not feeling adventurous.  Located at Willow Bend Mall.
content=Central Expwy Service Rd @ W Parker Rd. Cheap and delicious South Indian joint. Check it out.
directions=SE corner of Greenville Ave (HWY 5) & Bethany Rd

content=In Allen.  This little place has very good homemade, authentic Mexican food.  Has dine-in or carry-out and is very reasonably priced.  Serves breakfast/lunch/dinner.  Don't forget the sopaipillas for dessert!
directions=Southbound Central Expy between Parker and Park.  Corner of Central Expressway and Enterprise Dr.  DART Bus #350.

content=All the delightful flavors of Polish cuisine in an upscale art cafe.  If Polish food is completely foreign to you, then try the Tate of Poland for $25.  It's big enough for two.  A small Polish foods market and deli are also on site.
content=Some of the best sushi in Plano.  BYOB.  Ask for the daily special menu.

content=Dallas Metroplex. Phone: +1 972-509-7979, Delivery: +1 469-330-9700. Just a few of Thai Samba's signature dishes are, pepper steak, garlic chicken, cashew chicken, seafood noodle and seafood chili paste, lemon grass, and crab meat fried rice, which satisfy meat lovers as well as non-meat eaters. Located outside Collin Creek Mall Across From Macy’s Around The Corner From JoAnn Fabrics Next To Verizon Wireless.
directions=West side of Central Expressway between Spring Creek Pkwy and Parker Rd. No DART bus stop within 1/2 mile.

content=This is part of a chain that has locations around the country.  While this is officially a bar, they're still a good place to get some really good chicken wings, burgers, and various other finger foods.  Almost everything there can be coated in one of 14 different sauces ranging from a mild and sweet BBQ sauce to their unbearably hot Blazin'.
directions=SE corner of 15th St and J Ave.  DART Downtown Plano Rail Station.

content=An excellent pub located in Plano's historic district.  This is one of several pubs located close together, making for an excellent pub crawl.  It's usually very noisy and crowded on the weekends.
content=great atmosphere with outside patio and palm trees
content=Unique quality american food also great tequila bar
directions=NE corner of 15th St and J Ave.  DART Downtown Plano Rail station.

content=A great place to drink, with a wide variety of beers, ciders and mixed drinks.  Along with that they also have some tasty finger foods and sandwiches to go along with your alcohol.  People can reserve the large room in the back for social gatherings.
name=Dallas/Plano Marriott at Legacy Town Center,
content=Offers 20 meeting rooms with 32,000 sq. ft. of meeting space. Close to Shops at Legacy, high-end shopping and dining. Complimentary shuttle.
content=20 miles from Dallas, 30 miles from DFW Airport, and Dallas Love Field Airport is 20 miles from this Holiday Inn hotel. Plano center is under a mile down the road.
content=Close to DFW Airport and only 20 miles north of downtown Dallas.
address=5005 Whitestone Lane,  Plano, Texas 75024 USA
content=TownePlace Suites Dallas Plano is perfect for business or leisure. This hotel offers a comfortable atmosphere that is both productive and relaxing.
content=Ultramodern hotel with meeting space and package deals on rooms.

content=The highlight of the new lobby is The Bistro   which provides healthy offerings in the morning, plus dinner service with cocktail selections in the evening. Also has 2 meeting rooms, great for business meetings or social gatherings such as reunions and howers.
content=Addison Airport and downtown Addison are only 10 miles from the hotel, and downtown Dallas another 17. Fully equiped kitchens and pet friendly!
content=Stylish, affordable rooms and suites. Fairfield Inn & Suites The Colony/Plano is just 2 miles to Plano Legacy Park, Stonebriar Mall & the Shops at the Legacy. Free Wifi. Free Breakfast.
content=All suite hotel ideal for hotel stays of 1 or over 30 days. Just 2 miles to Plano Legacy Park, Stonebriar Mall, Shops at Legacy. Fully equipped kitchen, living area, free WiFi.
